content.description:
Interesting arete/face climbing.

Pass a couple of bolts on overhanging rock to obtain a flake/crack.  Another bolt leads to the arete proper and a surprise hidden feature at the base of it. Tricky, somewhat inobvious moves lead past crux bolts to a final easy crack.
content.protection: 7 bolts, optional piece of gear ~2" (a little sporty without), mussy anchor.

content.description: Go over a couple of overlapping features to start.  Move right to the arete and follow this until it's obvious to move back left into the center of the face for the last few bolts and the last little boulder problem.

climbs.name: Cyanosis
climbs.fa: FA: Mark Ledel, Chris Keith, 11/89 (A3+) ; FFA: Darrell Hensel, Tai DeVore, 2/14

content.description:
Follow the striking seam (pretty much pure face) that ever so slowly starts to open near the top.

Starts off the sloping ledge/block at the base of the seam.  The first bolt is intentionally high to prevent problems with grounding from the second bolt. The crimping starts immediately, consider stick clipping...

Originally an old aid line.  The two 1/4" hangerless button heads (they cabled/keyhole hangered on the aid ascent?) were almost flush and out of the way so they were left in the event that someone craves an aid experience equivelent to the FA.
content.location: Obvious clean slab located on the second tier immediately right of Main Line, almost directly above Seam Grip.  There is a vertical black inclusion (dike) from the ground leading to the bottom left of this face.

content.description:
Climb the crack in the right facing corner (plus big face holds.)

This route can also serve as a means of obtaining the ledge system at the top of the harder slab routes, and from there all anchors can be reached to set up top ropes with a tiny bit of down-scrambling.
content.location: Up and right around the corner from Trickinosis.  Obvious right facing corner.

content.description:
The name sort of says it - an easy diagnosis, even from the ground.  No stopper moves, but pretty unrelenting from bolts 2-9 with a couple of thin clips due to the nature of the climbing.

Start with the easy right leaning seam/crack to a high(ish) first bolt, then straight up the streak to obtain the start of a faint left leaning seam.  Follow this a bit, then straight up again.
content.location: Starts at the bottom right of the block at the base of Cyanosis.
